column1: Cognitive load and teaching - ISL - Stimulated Recall

You will be presented a set of 10-second clips extracted from one of your lessons. Please watch each of them (as many times as you like) and try to remember/assess how much *mental effort* you were spending at that precise moment, using the 9-point scales below. Then, state the number of the snippet you just marked and *explain briefly (i.e., say out loud) the rationale* behind your mental effort score for that clip. Then, proceed to the next clip.

column3: How much effort were you spending at that time?

column5: 5: Neither high nor low mental effort
